title: VA - Greetings from Mexico - Best of Mariachi 2 CD Set [FLAC]
description:
Mexico is a traveller's paradise, packed with a large number of contrasting identities, desert landscapes, snow-capped volcanoes, ancient ruins, industrialised cities, time-warped colonial towns, glitzy resorts, lonely beaches and a world-beating collection of flora and fauna.

Mariachi is an urban style of Mexican music that originated in the central part of Mexico. The origin of the name is said to have been derived from the French word 'marriage', but some think it may be a combination of the name 'Maria' with the Nahuati diminutive suffix 'chi'. The original ensemble consisted of two violins, a vihuela (also known as guitarra - a regional name for a small guitar with five strings), jarana (a slightly larger five-string guitar), and a harp which, due to its awkward shape, was later replaced by the guitarro (a large, acoustic bass guitar with four strings).
